item.title: Report E-2024080511
item.description:
Report E-2024080511

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-17
  • City: DORAL
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS MIAMI FLORIDA FACILITY, ONE BLACK SHRINKED WRAPPED WOODEN SKID SHIPPING AIR CARGO SERVICE TO COLOMBIA WAS FOUND TO CONTAIN FLAMMABLE PRODUCTS. DURING THE SCREENING PROCESS WHILE CUTTING THE BLACK SHRINK WRAPPING, SEVERAL BOXES WERE FOUND WITH CLASS NINE DIAMOND LABELS AND AIR LIMITED QUANTITY MARKS. OTHER BOXES WERE FOUND WITH GROUND LIMITED QUANTITY MARKS. INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS OF THESE BOXES FOUND NUMEROUS FLAMMABLE PERFUMERY PRODUCTS. THE FREIGHT WAS OFFERED FOR AIR TRANSPORTATION TO UPS AIR CARGO WITHOUT ANY DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BLACK SHRINK WRAPPING. THERE WAS NO INDICATION ON THE AIR WAYBILL THAT DANGEROUS GOOD PRODUCTS WERE BEING SHIPPED AIR SERVICE. THE ISSUING CARRIER'S AGENT NAME AND CITY ON THE AIR WAYBILL IS ALSEATRANS US, 1665 NW 102ND AV, SUITE 108, MIAMI FL, 33172, US. THE SHIPPER'S NAME AND ADDRESS ON THE AIR WAYBILL IS MSL INTL GROUP, LLC, 1665 NW 102ND AV, MIAMI FL US.

item.title: Report X-2024081276
item.description:
Report X-2024081276

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-22T18:16:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-09
  • City: JACKSONVILLE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 1. X-2024081276 RESPONDER RESPONDED TO CALL OF LEAKING PACKAGE, PACKAGE WAS WET ON THE GROUND INSIDE THE TRUCK BEING LOADED. RESPONDER IN FULL PPE PLACED PACKAGE INTO CHEMICAL RESIST TRAY, RESPONDER ABSORBED SMALL PUDDLE ON FLOOR OF THE TRUCK WITH ZEP, RESPONDER HEADED BACK TO THE DMP CAGE WITH PACKAGE TO BE PROCESSED. 2. X-2024081277 PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT BACK TO DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. 3. X-2024081279 NO COMMENTS PROVIDED.

item.title: Report E-2024080493
item.description:
Report E-2024080493

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-22T18:16:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-06
  • City: PEMBROKE PINES
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 6, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon container of ZeroTolÂ® 2.0 was damaged and released approximately its full contents to the trailer interior and concrete below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from American Safety (AS) to remediate the impacted site. AS personnel noted the release had previously been remediated by RLC personnel. AS personnel collected the one (1) empty damaged 5-gallon container of ZeroTol 2.0 and containerized it into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum as waste. AS personnel then collected the cleanup debris and containerized it into the one (1) 55-gallon poly drum as well. All ZeroTol 2.0 impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon poly drum that was staged on-site

item.title: Report I-2024080043
item.description:
Report I-2024080043

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-04
  • City: West Palm Beach
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHWEST AIRLINES CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Southwest Airlines F3204 departed Chicago Midway Airport(MDW) in route to Miami International Airport (MIA) but diverted to West Palm Beach Airport(PBI). On final decent into MIA about 25 minutes until landing when we experienced a fire and smoke on board froni a cell phone and power bank. Flight attendants used the on board fire containment bag and safety measures. Aircraft terminated in PBI and passengers were re-accommodated to MIA. Pictures available upon request. SWA FAA PHI David Evans and FAA Hazardous Material Aviation Safety Inspector Santos L Garcia have been provided pictures and information.
